review_blob: Citrus-piney resin notes. Looks like a Czech lager. Light bodied, thin, under soft carbonation. Long-astringent finish. Overall, I think this beer is trying too hard with the imbalance and the high IBU.
On tap in a pint glass at Fouders. Maple and bourbon aroma. Black with dark tan lacing. Medium sweet and bitter. Light and tin with soft carbonation. Long bitter-sweet finish.
beer_name: Founders Backstage Series # 2: CBS (Canadian Breakfast Stout)

review_blob: 12 oz bottle in a wine glass. Bourbon and maple nose. Caramel appearance with off-white almost non-existent head fading to a lovely lacing. Medium sourness, medium sweet and heavy hop bitterness. Creamy, light syrupy texture. Extremely soft carbonation gives a pleasant bite. Finishes smooth and bitter.

This was awesome. I dont like Doppelbocks all that much, but this made me a believer. Smooth and velvety with roasted malt undertones not too overpowering. Ever so slight hop tinge, but full in the mouth. Delicious and satisfying!
12 oz into a glass. Citrus wheat, somewhat malty sweet balancing the slight banana and clove nose. I loved this. Would try again in the summer!
12 oz bottle into my face. Malty sweet and slight hoppy aroma. Reminds me of a New Castle, except a bit lighter on the palate. Easy to drink. I would recommend this to others.

Light floral aroma. Hazy, light golden color with off-white head. Light bodied, thin, malty sweetness with a tinge of citrus. Lightly carbonated with an abrupt sweet finish. Highly drinkable, albeit thin, and seemingly light on the hops for a pale ale. I was expecting more.

Opaque brown with tan head. Berry, and black licorice aromas. Heavy sweet, medium bitter, medium-heavy sour. Soft carbonation, medium bodied, heavy sweet into long medium sweet finish. Quite rich, but a great experience nevertheless.
Amber/gold with white foam. Cherry, apple, honey, pineapple aromas. Heavy sweet and lightly sour. Light bodied, lightly carbonated, long, sweet finish. Highly drinkable. Quite a treat!
Redwood, khaki head fades to a white ring. Bubbly carbonation. Banana, nut, and caramel aroma. Heavy sweet into light sour with faint, short, bitter finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Lovely.

12.8 oz in a snifter. Opaque, golden-red, with khaki foam. Aroma of flowers and honey. Lots of fruit. Sour, and lightly bitter. Light sweetness and a sweet and sour finish. Soft carbonation, long sour finish. I like the sourness with the mega-fruitiness.

Floral, banana aromas. Pale, opaque, golden color. Minimal off-white head with bubbly lacing. Not too bitter for an IPA; almost sweet. Med/full bodied, somewhat thick texture. Soft carbonation. Semi-astringent, long bitter finish. Nice, but the finish is too aggressive for me.

Coffee, toffee, chocolate aromas. Opaque appearance with tan ring. Medium-heavy bitter, lightly sour, medium sweet. Medium body, oily, soft carbonation. Long, bitter, toffee finish. Not too much roasted barley, which I like in an Imperial Russian Stout. Would try it again.

12 oz bottle from Bells General Store. Pungent, flowery hop aroma. Goldenrod appearance, thin white lace. Heavy bitterness, lightly sweet flavor. Medium bodied, thicker texture. Soft carbonation. A bit too long of a bitter finish for my taste. Otherwise, a nice Imperial/Double IPA.

11.2 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Subtle caramel malty, candi, and dried fruit aromas. Hazy brown color, sparkling, poured a thick off-white head slowly fading to a nice minimal lace. Medium sweet, medium bitterness. Full bodied, thin texture, lively carbonation, definite sharpness, then bitter-sweet finish. Found it quite aggressive with its aromas and effect on my palate, but liked it more, the more I sipped. Would try this again.

Strong floral hoppy aroma. Goldenrod appearance, minimal off white head. Light sweetness, medium bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, long bitter finish. A well-balanced IPA. Delicious and refreshing!

Tried this hand-pull, then went for another on nitrogen in a pint glass. Fruity hop aroma. Dark amber in color. Medium-heavy bitter, medium sweet, and lightly sour. Medium bodied/textured. Flat carbonation and long bitter finish. A good beer, but didnt knock my socks off.
beer_name: The Livery Old Cedar English Strong Ale

review_blob: On tap in a snifter. Dried fruit (plum? apricot?) overtaking sweet malty aroma. Opaque caramel color with white ring around the glass. Medium-heavy sweetness overpowered by very heavy sourness. Cidery on the palate with a light texture and carbonation. Long and predominant sour and sharp finish. I enjoyed this thoroughly, although may be too boozy for some.
beer_name: The Livery Barrel Aged Umami Wheat Wine

review_blob: 12 oz. into a snifter. Pours black with khaki head. Roasted malt and vanilla aroma. Medium bitter, lightly sweet. Medium heavy bodied, creamy feel, with light carbonation finishing sweet, dry then slight hop bitterness. Highly drinkable.

12 oz. into a snifter. Pours black with abundant tan head fading to frothy ring. Mocha, toffee, and fruity nose. Heavy bitter, medium sweet. Lightly carbonated, dried fruit, coffee, thick, creamy, chewy, sweet, finishing long, boozy, and very bitter. An exceptional example of this style, albeit a bit too harshly bitter.
beer_name: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Aromas of dried cranberries, yeast, plum, and fig. Pours a dark amber, with off-white head; yeast flecks in suspension. Medium sweet, lightly sour, and lightly bitter flavors. Thick feel, medium bodied, lightly carbonated. Sweet and sour finish leaves one wanting more.

750 ml bottle into a wide, shallow, crystal champagne glass. Aromas of booze, yeast, malt, with a tinge of fruit-citrus. Poured cloudy from suspended yeast into the glass a dark reddish-brown with off-white head fading to dots of foam on the surface then into a thick ring; easily roused back to life. Heavy sweetness, medium sour, and lightly bitter flavor. Thick feel, thin bodied, softly carbonated with a malty sweet, med-long, dry-booze finish. Tastes of sweet, nutty, roasted malts, fruit, and spicy cloves. I really like this beer. Left me wanting more!

Tap at Founders in a pint glass. Piney aroma. Opaque red with off-white foam. Lightly sweet and medium bitter. Thin feel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, and long bitter finish. Hoppy but not too hoppy. The rye with hops reminds me of gin. Big rye taste.

Tap at Founders in a snifter. Bourbon and vanilla scented. Black with minimal brown head fading to a tan color. Medium-bitter and medium-heavy sweet but well balanced. Medium-heavy bodied, light carbonation, with thin feel makes for smooth travel down the throat with sweet finish. Very drinkable.

Tap at Founders cafe in a pint glass. Coffee and chocolate aroma. Black colored with dark tan head. Medium sweet and heavy bitterness. Thick cocoa/coffee oily feel, heavy bodied with long bitter coffee finish. Tastes of chocolate progressing to boozy coffee.
Citrusy/fruity, sour-dough bread aroma. Goldenrod colored with white foam. Lightly sweet and med-light sour. Thin feel, medium bodied, short finish. Tastes of iced tea with lemon.
beer_name: Founders Solid Gold Extra Pale Ale

review_blob: 12 oz. Malty barley, floral hoppy nose. Orange colored with abrupt off-white/tan head dying into a foam ring. Mid-heavy sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, thin feel, light carbonation. Initially sweet into med-long finish. Strong maltiness, hint of honey. Prominent but not overpowering hop taste balanced well by sweet malt. Better than the average Imperial IPA.

First hand-pull from freshly tapped keg in a pint glass. Strong honey, and malty nose. Honey colored, thick off-white persistent head. Medium bitter and medium sweet. Mid-heavy body, creamy feel, light carbonation, bittersweet long finish. Delicious! Lots of honey, malty taste, with toffee. Light, but not too light. Highly drinkable.

Tap into a snifter at Eccentric Cafe. Fruity/floral, candy aroma. Chardonnay colored, with almost non-existent head. Mid-heavy sweet. Thin feel, light bodied, soft carbonation, sweet but not overpowering or too long of a finish. Tastes of sweet green apples and honey. I suggest that one let it warm up a little in order to fully enjoy it, as it is served quite cold. A very drinkable mead.

Hand-pull into a16oz pint glass. Malty hop aroma. Reddish-orange in color. Tan head, easily reawakened. Heavy bitter, medium sweet. Med-heavy body, thin-cream feel, light carbonation, long bitter finish. Tastes are quite faint for a barley wine, although I found rye, caramel and honey.

12 oz into a snifter. Wine and honey aromas. Orange/gold with white head. Medium sour, med-heavy sweet. Alcohol is hidden well. Light bodied, sticky, finishing sweet saffron. Not quite an ale in my opinion, but it somehow works.
beer_name: Dogfish Head Midas Touch Golden Elixir

review_blob: Strong hops, fruity and floral, light malty aromas. Opaque reddish-brown, with white tan head receding into a ring. Heavy bitter flavor. Smooth, medium bodied, thin texture, and softly carbonated into long alcoholic bitterness.

12 oz into a snifter. Pours like oil with minimal tan head. Chocolate, coffee, toffee, burnt marshmallow, very light hops, and malt aromas. Lightly sweet rolling down the tongue to heavy but not overwhelming bitterness. Dried fruit proceeding into a boozy-mocha explosion; full bodied, oil-slick feel, extremely slight carbonation, and extra-long, bitter, roasty, finish.

12 oz bottle in a brandy snifter. Light yeast aroma. Gold colored, with a faint white ring of foam around the glass. Medium bitter, lightly sweet. Resembles more of a lager/pils than a belgian. Thin texture, light body, little carbonation. Not much going on here. Much too light in body, texture, and flavor.

12 oz bottle into a brandy glass. Cherry, light malty, and overripe fruit aroma. Dark red color with ring of off-white head. Medium bitter, medium sweet, and medium sour, all blend well hiding the alcohol. Medium bodied, thin textured, fizzy on the tongue. Kriek initially on the palate, into sweet raisins, and malt finishing sweet abruptly then into long bitter-sour. Overall, a worthy Quad.
Nutty, malty, brown sugar aroma. Mahogany color, with off-white head, thin appearance. Lightly bitter, medium sweet. Medium body, thin texture, almost flat carbonation. Short, bitter finish.
Spicy, floral hop aroma. Light brown color with brief white head. Lightly sweet with medium bitterness. Dry, thin bodied with little carbonation and hints of brown sugar.

Chocolate, strong coffee, burnt caramel, toffee aromas. Reddish-dark-brown, brief minimal tan-white head. Medium sweet, heavy bitterness. Heavy bodied, soft carbonation, finishing long bitter mocha. A decent beer. Probably would enjoy it in cooler weather.

12 oz. bottle poured into a tulip. Floral, citrus hops, bread yeast aroma. Gold color, very fizzy appearance. Thick white lingering head lasted the whole glass. Lightly sweet, med-light sour, light bitterness. Medium bodied, cream-like texture, fizzy carbonation, long sour finish. A great Belgian-style!
Floral hops, light bread-yeast aroma. Pours a caramel color with a brief white head. Medium sweet, lightly sour. Lively carbonation, thin body, finishes long sour apple.
Fruity, citrus hops aroma. Cloudy, pale, pineapple color. Light-medium sweet, light bitterness. Fizzy, lemon texture, medium body, finished long and sour.

Fruity, malty sweet aroma. Deep-reddish brown color with thick, off-white, creamy, lingering head. Flavored heavy sweet, light bitterness, medium sourness. Candy, caramel, smooth into spice and pepper.

Sweet caramel, malty aroma with a whiff of coffee. Clear rust appearance. Medium sweetness and bitterness with a hint of salt. Medium body, thin oily texture, soft carbonation. Long, bitter nutty finish. Simple and tasty.
Stale corn aroma. Fain yellow urine color with frothy white head. Medium sweet flavor with short finish. Light body, thin feel, and soft carbonation. Cheap swill.
I think someone in the reviews wrote hint of corn, and I was thinking the same thing. Like a cheap bulk, plain, corn cereal. Refreshing, when you need something other than water. Could be much worse.
floral, citrus, pale, golden, hazy, minimal, white head, light sweetness, very sharp bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, bitter, astringent, long finish,
fruity, floral aroma, orangish-red hue, off-white head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, fizzy, thin feel, medium body, abrupt finish.

freshly-tapped keg pull in a pint glass.

sweet malty aroma, black, frothy, tan foam, initial coffee flavor into mild caramel with a touch of cocoa.

lightly sweet, milky-thin flavor with medium-heavy bitterness. not as creamy or heavily bodied as the normal run-of-the-mill US guinness draft.

medium body, thin feel, lightly carbonated, with bittersweet finish.
sweet aroma, toffee/caramel, dark reddish orange, lingering white head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,
cereal, golden, clear, pale white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, salty, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
